parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or party affiliation.  The content focuses on encouraging informed voting in general, not endorsing a particular candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message ("Don't leave the elections to chance!") is clearly intended for a broad audience, not a specific individual or small group.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post relates to the electoral process, its objective is not to directly influence the vote for or against any particular candidate. The aim is to encourage voter participation and informed decision-making. The website linked, eucucinevotez.eu, suggests a tool for comparing candidates' platforms, promoting informed choices rather than advocating for specific candidates.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post's content and style align with citizen journalism or public service announcements. It aims to educate and inform voters about the importance of making informed choices, without advocating for any specific political party or candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; instead, it promotes a non-partisan initiative to encourage informed voting.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1098683801963032</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while related to the electoral process, does not constitute electoral propaganda under Article 98 t) of LEGE nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015.  It promotes informed voting through a compatibility test, encouraging voters to research candidates' platforms before casting their ballots. This action promotes civic engagement and informed decision-making, not the endorsement of a specific candidate or party. The post does not violate Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006 because it lacks the direct reference to a candidate (a), its objective is not to influence votes for a specific candidate (c), and it falls under the category of journalistic/educational content (d).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>DifinePR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
